Greetings!

My name is Artur Madjidov.
I am currently a software developer.
This static website is here to show you some technical info about me.

  • Programming
  • Multimedia
  • JavaScript

    I get to practice JavaScript frontend web developpement on a daily basis.

    I used to mainly use jQuery because of how less verbose the syntax seemed comapred to vanilla JS, but with time I started to realize how powerfull vanilla JS is without the need of using jQuery.

  • HTML & CSS

    Alongside clientside JavaScript, I practice HTML and CSS daily (duh).

    I was lucky enough to be required to support legacy browsers during developpement of some projects. I consider this a major strength, because it makes you realize how little standard there was only a few years ago.

    At the moment I get to work with the latest features of HTML5 and CSS'3'(meaning the latest multi-browser supported css features).

  • C#

    C# is currently the primary programming language I use for applications' backend both at work and personally.

    I enjoy the surface use simplicity of the language (from the syntax, to the common use of core elements), as well as how far you can push it (something I probably didn't even scratch the surface of).

  • Java

    I never had the opportunity to practice Java at work, but I did do a lot of it in College.

    It is often matched against C# - I personally prefer C# over Java - for a special reason. I highly dislike Java IDEs. Some language quirks also suck, but I'm not efficient if my IDE is hot trash

  • SQL (T-SQL)

    I'll be the first to admit - SQL in any form - is not my strongest suit.

    I do however have enough experience and knowledge to create and modify tables, sotred procedures, functions and triggers.

  • SQL (Oracle)

    I'll be the first to admit - SQL in any form - is not my strongest suit.

    I did however spent countless hours working with Oracle software in College. So I will definitly find my way

  • Visual Basic

    I feel comfortable with placing VB in this section, as I got to use it both at college and in supporting legacy applications at work.

  • PHP

    Event though PHP was the main language I had to use for web applications when I was in college, I had very little professional experience with the langugage.

    Professionally, I used it for modifying some wordpress websites, as well as repairing some websites.

  • TypeScript

    I find TypeScript to be an excelent tool to make complex functionnalities with JS, as well as making you understand JS so much more. I also believe that it is harmful on small scale frontend projects, as it only slows down the process from my little experiences.

  • C++

    Even though my second programming lesson in College was all about C++, I can confirm that I hardly recall the syntax, but do wish to master this language in the enxt few years.

  • PostScript

    While transforming a WinForms application from VB6 to C#, I had to over a process for generating a pretty massive PostScript file.

    I know the basics, can read it, but do not have enough experience to draw anything.
    I also believe that knowing to do that is becoming more unnecessary with time. So many more user/programmer friendly programms exist now, like the SSRS builder in Visual Studio.
